DataItem.name: bi1577
DataItem.xref: Does your organization contribute to a data-sharing consortium for purposes of detecting or preventing fraud?

DataItem.name: bi1578
DataItem.xref: Does your organization currently use a digital forensics/e-discovery software program or system as part of its anti-fraud initiatives?

DataItem.name: bi1579
DataItem.xref: Does your organization currently use a formal case management software program or system as part of its anti-fraud initiatives?

DataItem.name: bi1580
DataItem.xref: Does your organization currently use a specialized program or system for capturing and storing online evidence obtained as part of fraud investigations?

DataItem.name: bi1586
DataItem.xref: For which of the following areas of fraud risk does your organization currently use data analytics or automated monitoring tools to identify red flags of potential fraud?

DataItem.name: bi1600
DataItem.xref: How beneficial has the use of data analytics been in each of the following areas of your organizations anti-fraud initiatives?

DataItem.name: bi1601
DataItem.xref: How much of a challenge do each of the following factors present in implementing new anti-fraud technology in your organization?

DataItem.name: bi1607
DataItem.xref: Law enforcement or government watch lists

DataItem.name: bi1631
DataItem.xref: Which of the following data sources does your organization currently pull from in conducting its anti-fraud data analytics initiatives?

DataItem.name: bi1632
DataItem.xref: Which of the following emerging technologies does your organization currently use or expect to use as part of its anti-fraud initiatives?

DataItem.name: bi1633
DataItem.xref: Which of the following types of data analytics does your organization currently use as part of its anti-fraud initiatives?

DataItem.name: bi1634
DataItem.xref: Which of the following types of data analytics technologies do you expect your organization to adopt or deploy in the next 12 years?

DataItem.name: bi9530
DataItem.xref: Over the next 2 years, how is your organizations budget for anti-fraud technology expected to change?

DataItem.name: bi9531
DataItem.xref: Physical biometrics (e.g., fingerprint, facial, or vocal recognition)

DataItem.name: bi9538
DataItem.xref: Theft or fraud involving receipts/incoming payments

DataItem.name: bi9546
DataItem.xref: How has the COVID-19 pandemic affected your organization's use of anti-fraud technology?

DataItem.name: bi9549
DataItem.xref: Behavioral biometrics (e.g., keystroke recognition, device usage patterns, or signature dynamics)

DataItem.name: bi9558
DataItem.xref: Computer vision analytics (i.e., computer/artificial intelligence-based analysis of videos or photographs)

DataItem.name: bi4746
DataItem.label: Anti-fraud technology budget for next two years

Text.name: ve2632
Text.label: Business and Data Source Profile Functionality

Span.Span: Functionality:
Select a value from the dropdown menus to filter the graphs. When a filter is applied, click the X above to remove. Note: any chart
with less than 10 responses will not be visually represented.

Text.name: ve2670
Text.label: Fraud Tech and Analytics Investment Functionality

Span.Span: Functionality:

Select a value from the dropdown menus to filter the graphs or select a value from either of the charts to filter the other chart. When a filter is applied, click the X above to remove.Note: any chart with less than 10 responses will not be visually represented.

Text.name: ve2675
Text.label: Challenge in New Tech Implementation Description

Span.Span: Description:
Respondents who believe their anti-fraud budget will significantly increase over the next 2 years experience a decrease in all challengesexceptData Quality.
Description:
In-house resources perceive more risk in implementing new anti-fraud technologies than respondents in other roles.
Functionality:
The size of the blue dots representthe frequency of respondents who are from each region. Hover over theblue dot to get more information about the region.

Span.Span: Functionality:

Click any component of a chart to filter the other charts on the page. When a filter is applied, click the X above to remove.Note: any chart with less than 10 responses will not be visually represented.

KPI.name: ve2557
KPI.label: Lack of Perceived ROI for each Budget/Financial restrictions
KPI.description: Lack of Perceived ROI for each Budget/Financial restrictions group. There are four different gauges representing each financial/budget restrictions group.

Span.Span: Description:
The largest number of respondents are from government and public administration (18%), and most respondents are in-house examiners (50%).

Text.name: ve8540

If a respondent finds one of the value drivers to be beneficial, the same is true for the other value drivers.

Text.name: ve8576
Text.label: Challenge in New Tech Implementations Functionality

Span.Span: Functionality:
Select a value from the dropdown menus to filter the graphs. When a filter is applied, click the X above to remove.Note: any chart with less than 10 responses will not be visually represented.
Description:
Nearly half of the respondents (39%) are from the United States and Canada. The other respondents are from 8 other regions across the globe.
Functionality:
Select a value from either of the charts to filter the other chart. When a filter is applied, click the X above to remove.Note: any chart with less than 10 responses will not be visually represented.
Functionality:
Select a value from either of the charts to filter the other. When a filter is applied, click the X to remove.Note: Note: any chart with less than 10 responses will not be visually represented.

Text.name: ve8673
Text.label: Business and Data Source Profile Description

Span.Span: Description:

The risk areas where organizations most commonly use data analytics to monitor for potential fraud are Purchasing and Disbursements. The most common data source used in Anti-Fraud analytics is Internal Structured Data. Certain regions rely more heavily on Internal Unstructured Data than others.

Span.Span: Description:
Over the next 2 years, advanced methods such as Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning are expected to be integrated as part of organizations anti-fraud programs significantly.
